name: BOYS & GIRLS CLUB OF SANTA BARBARA
introduction: The Boys & Girls Club of Santa Barbara, Inc. has been changing lives for almost 75 years. Since 1938 when the first local Club was opened, we have provided young people with hope and opportunity, a safe place to learn and grow, ongoing relationships with caring, adult professionals and life-enhancing programs and character development experiences.Located in the downtown region of Santa Barbara, the Boys & Girls Club of Santa Barbara fulfills an unquestionable need: keeping local children off the street, out of trouble, and in a positive learning environment. Today, the Boys & Girls Club of Santa Barbara serves over 1,500 local youth and their families. Our Club is staffed by paid, trained youth development professionals who, through a system of informal guidance, form strong bonds with young people and help them make smart choices in life. For many Club members, Club staff are the most influential positive adult role model in their lives.

name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUBS OF FRESNO COUNTY - EAST FRESNO BOYS & GIRLS CLUB
introduction: Boys & Girls Clubs of Fresno County open their doors as the Boys Club of Fresno in 1949 at 1219 Tulare Street in a small surplus building. The club moved to its' cuurent location at 930 Tulare Street ten years later. The East Fresno Club was added in 1962 at Hamilton and Chance, before they moved to their current site at 1621 South cedar in 1976. The optimist clubs of Fresno decided to open a club in northern Fresno,  and settled on a location in Pinedale where the club was open in 1966 at 343 West Minarets in an old railroad station building. In 1985, girls were offically invited into the Boys Club, and our name was changed to the Boys & Girls Clubs of Fresno. 1992-1993 saw us grow dramatically when we open clubs throughout Fresno County including Del Rey, Parlier, Orange Cove, Huran, and Firebaugh; and in 1993, the Board of Directors officially change the name to Boys & Girls Clubs of Fresno County. In 1996 saw us open our  latest and biggest clubhouse, the Zimmerman Boys & Girls Club, located at 540 N. Augusta. In the new millenium, a new clubs open Oakhurst, Clovis, Sanger, and Reedley.
